body:
Sure, will add an example (there is one in the docstring, but is much more limited).

Regarding the `gsutil`, it was intentionally designed to mimic the way POSIX commands work, so it also presents the "directory" abstraction. :slightly_smiling_face:
Rebase done @Fokko

Thanks @berislavlopac . Appreciate the changes.

üëç LGTM
LGTM. Thank you for your contribution. üëç

@andscoop Yes.. open a new PR and refer to this closed one.
Thanks all!
Thanks @albertocalderari
Thanks @Fokko, Noted for the future :).

hey @Fokko , I really can't tell what jenkins fails :(

Hey @feng-tao, looking at the error, retriggering Jenkins won't help. The problem is that the `snakebite` package isn't Python3 compatible: https://github.com/spotify/snakebite/issues/62

To be honest, it isn't completely clear to me why this `hdfs_hook.py`, that is dependent on the Snakebite package, is loaded now: https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/tests/core.py#L2317

Changing these lines from:
```
try:
    from airflow.hooks.hdfs_hook import HDFSHook
    import snakebite
except ImportError:
    HDFSHook = None
```

To:
```
HDFSHook = None
if six.PY3:
    from airflow.hooks.hdfs_hook import HDFSHook
    import snakebite
```
Should solve the problem. 

Cheers!

Buongiorno @gglanzani, 

Can you take a look at this? My knowledge of Apache Hive is futile compared to yours..

Cheers!
Hmm, I don't really trust the failed tests, rebased against master: https://travis-ci.org/Fokko/incubator-airflow/builds/379609692
I'm seeing the same error at https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3360

@Fokko It seems good to me, valid use case.

@sekikn Could you close and re-open to re-trigger the Python 3.5 tests, that are failing for some other reason?

Thanks @gglanzani 

The tests seem to fail on Snakebite, which is not Python 3.x compatible:
```
======================================================================
1) ERROR: Failure: SyntaxError (invalid syntax (client.py, line 1473))
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    .tox/py35-backend_sqlite/lib/python3.5/site-packages/nose/failure.py line 39 in runTest
      raise self.exc_val.with_traceback(self.tb)
    .tox/py35-backend_sqlite/lib/python3.5/site-packages/nose/loader.py line 418 in loadTestsFromName
      addr.filename, addr.module)
    .tox/py35-backend_sqlite/lib/python3.5/site-packages/nose/importer.py line 47 in importFromPath
      return self.importFromDir(dir_path, fqname)
    .tox/py35-backend_sqlite/lib/python3.5/site-packages/nose/importer.py line 94 in importFromDir
      mod = load_module(part_fqname, fh, filename, desc)
    /home/travis/build/apache/incubator-airflow/.tox/py35-backend_sqlite/lib/python3.5/imp.py line 245 in load_module
      return load_package(name, filename)
    /home/travis/build/apache/incubator-airflow/.tox/py35-backend_sqlite/lib/python3.5/imp.py line 217 in load_package
      return _load(spec)
    <frozen importlib._bootstrap> line 693 in _load
      
    <frozen importlib._bootstrap> line 673 in _load_unlocked
      
    <frozen importlib._bootstrap_external> line 697 in exec_module
      
    <frozen importlib._bootstrap> line 222 in _call_with_frames_removed
      
    tests/__init__.py line 27 in <module>
      from .core import *
    tests/core.py line 2317 in <module>
      from airflow.hooks.hdfs_hook import HDFSHook
    airflow/hooks/hdfs_hook.py line 25 in <module>
      from snakebite.client import Client, HAClient, Namenode, AutoConfigClient
   SyntaxError: invalid syntax (client.py, line 1473)
```

Please don't naively retrigger the tests if it is clear that something is wrong. This isn't a flaky test. I've addressed this earlier here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3342#issuecomment-389439015
@Fokko This is failing on `/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-airflow/tests/dags/test_impersonation_custom.py`, what does it have to do with this?

Not much, apparently the Snakebite stuff gets pulled in. But the test isn't executed under 3.5, so we also don't know if these tests pass under 3.5. Restarting the tests will give the same issues, so we first have to fix master.
@Fokko Clear! I'll leave it up to you then!
hey @Fokko , in this case since the error is not related, could we do it in a different pr for that issue?
@chribsen @bolkedebruin Next steps!

Failure from PY3 envs  are on Snakebitem which is consistent with other recent PRs.
Failures from PY2 envs are on the following two tests that did not fail prior to rebase.
- test_scheduler_sla_miss_callback_exception
- test_scheduler_sla_miss_email_exception
Doesnt seem to suggest any potential correlation with this PR, kinda odd.
@criccomini - ok to merge before 1.10?
Missed another import in tests, will fix

I am not following up on it as I am not working on airflow anymore.

You can fork my work and rebase it on the latest code if you need it.
Thanks for the review @gglanzani @Fokko! I'll re-trigger the CI once #3365 is merged.
@Tagar why do you have 2 commits? Why is the second one adding a dependency? Pls squash your commits. Also, provide a little more context on this upgrade in the JIRA.

@r39132 yeah the change is still relevant and valid, and we are using the same in our prod from past 1.5+yrs. I can rebase if the community thinks it's useful for them, otherwise, we can close this PR.

@jgao54 can you please limit the amount of closing and opening that you do? We have been contacted by Apache Infra explaining to us that we are taking up to 25% of total build time of Travis builds of all Apache projects. Please retry builds on your own account and point to successful builds there if necessary.
@bolkedebruin I'll be more mindful, sorry about that.
lgtm!

I believe there is some sort of race condition in that unit test, specifically in the method `create_dagrun`
```
            if next_run_date and period_end and period_end <= timezone.utcnow():
                next_run = dag.create_dagrun(
```
The if statement returned false so dagrun was never created. I haven't been able to understood why it's only failing in some of the tests sometimes, so the fix didn't quite solve the root problem. It seems like the next_run_date (and the corresponding end_date) is one interval ahead of what it should be.

For the sake of this PR, the failed tests can be ignored.
hey @Fokko , @jgao54 , @r39132, do you think if this pr still need any update from my side?
Thanks @r39132! The same fix was already merged as #3152, so I'll close this PR :)
@Fokko As promised earlier here is the test for rewrite method.
Rebased on master. Let's see if CI succeeds...
Please follow the commit guidelines.

```
1) ERROR: test_integration_run_dag_with_scheduler_failure (tests.contrib.minikube.test_kubernetes_executor.KubernetesExecutorTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    tests/contrib/minikube/test_kubernetes_executor.py line 175 in test_integration_run_dag_with_scheduler_failure
      result_json = self.start_dag(dag_id='example_python_operator', host=host)
    tests/contrib/minikube/test_kubernetes_executor.py line 137 in start_dag
      .format(result=result.json()))
    .tox/py27-backend_postgres/lib/python2.7/site-packages/requests/models.py line 892 in json
```
